ehm.exclusive-mode-help: the selected players do not appear in the player list
ehm.inclusive-mode-help: only selected players are displayed in the player list
ehm.log-in-warning: Your own credentials are required for this wizard. Do not use Hattrick credentials.
ehm.manual-1020: this manual explains the main features of Easy Hattrick Manager; hereafter we will refer to it as
ehm.manual-1100: once registration and sign-in are completed, you arrive at the main page.
ehm.manual-1120: a core part of EHM; it displays all information for each player as a card.
ehm.manual-1130: the information shown corresponds to the selected project and selected time point.
ehm.manual-1210: the user who has signed in to EHM is shown.
ehm.manual-1230: here you can change the system language.
ehm.manual-1240: this choice is saved for future visits.
ehm.manual-1250: by default, the language configured in Hattrick at registration time is used.
ehm.manual-1260: regarding translations, internally they are divided into two major groups
ehm.manual-1290: this includes skill names, player skill values, specialties, ...
ehm.manual-1300: this allows us to support all languages available on the platform.
ehm.manual-1330: translations into Spanish, Catalan, and English are done manually
ehm.manual-1340: for other languages, the open-source tool
ehm.manual-1360: if a language is not available, English is used by default.
ehm.manual-1370: feel free to report any translation errors.
ehm.manual-1390: allows you to change the currency shown in the system.
ehm.manual-1400: by default, the currency configured in Hattrick at registration time is used.
ehm.manual-1410: function to fetch the most recent data from Hattrick.
ehm.manual-1420: it is an option that, as a rule,
ehm.manual-1430: does not need to be used
ehm.manual-1440: since EHM aims to streamline this task; therefore,
ehm.manual-1450: it schedules an automatic execution to update Hattrick data.
ehm.manual-1460: the automatic run is scheduled weekly, specifically between 1 and 3 hours after the time defined in Hattrick.
ehm.manual-1470: it also has a retry policy in case of process failures.
ehm.manual-1480: likewise, and the main reason for providing this option in the menu is to be able to trigger it manually
ehm.manual-1490: if you notice that the data is not up to date.
ehm.manual-1500: after a manual update, you need to refresh EHM so the new data is shown.
ehm.manual-1510: EHM only allows one weekly data save per team to avoid duplicate data,
ehm.manual-1520: and within the week, the reference is the day of Hattrick's training update.
ehm.manual-1530: allows you to download a JSON file with all the information collected from your teams.
ehm.manual-1540: it is advisable to save this file regularly as a backup.
ehm.manual-1560: ends the current session and returns to the sign-in page.
ehm.manual-1590: link to the EHM code repository; the deployed version (vXX) is indicated.
ehm.manual-1610: link to the Hattrick user profile of the EHM creator.
ehm.manual-1620: this screen allows us to modify the list of projects we have in EHM.
ehm.manual-1630: a project is defined as a period of time for a specific team.
ehm.manual-1640: it's a way to configure how data is displayed.
ehm.manual-1650: there is no problem changing this configuration and playing with it, since the data is not altered,
ehm.manual-1660: I repeat: it's just a way to configure the view we want.
ehm.manual-1670: you can create as many projects as you need, and it's fine if they overlap in time.
ehm.manual-1681: upon registering, a project is created for each team, starting that same week and with no end date.
ehm.manual-1700: here you can modify the project configuration. By default it loads the current configuration.
ehm.manual-1710: it is shown as a table, where each row corresponds to a project.
ehm.manual-1720: the order of the projects in the list is respected when displaying them in the
ehm.manual-1740: button to add a new project.
ehm.manual-1780: dropdown to select the team the project belongs to.
ehm.manual-1800: dropdown to select the project's start week.
ehm.manual-1820: option to enable or not the project's end week.
ehm.manual-1830: if it is a current project, this option should appear disabled; that way EHM will show new data after each weekly update.
ehm.manual-1840: on the contrary, if it is a past, already finished project, this option should appear enabled so that we can select a specific end week.
ehm.manual-1860: dropdown to select the project's end week.
ehm.manual-1880: button to delete the project. Remember this action does not delete any data from the system.
ehm.manual-1900: button to return to the EHM main page without saving the new configuration.
ehm.manual-1920: button to save the new configuration and return to the EHM main page.
ehm.manual-1930: player sorting lets you set the order in which players are shown in the (1) player list.
ehm.manual-1940: EHM takes care of saving the sorting configuration per project.
ehm.manual-1960: there are two sorting modes, ascending or descending.
ehm.manual-1970: either numerically or alphabetically, depending on the chosen criterion.
ehm.manual-1980: if there are empty values, they are shown at the end; this applies, for example, to sorting by shirt number if a player has no number assigned.
ehm.manual-1990: by default, ascending mode is selected.
ehm.manual-2000: lets you choose the criterion by which players are sorted.
ehm.manual-2010: the player ID is used to break ties when the chosen criterion has the same value for multiple players.
ehm.manual-2020: by default, the player ID is selected.
ehm.manual-2030: player filtering lets you select which players you want to show in the (1) player list.
ehm.manual-2040: EHM takes care of saving the filtering configuration per project.
ehm.manual-2060: there are two filtering modes: inclusive mode and exclusive mode.
ehm.manual-2070: inclusive mode is used to show only the selected players.
ehm.manual-2080: this mode is very useful for projects where we want to track a small group of players and ignore the rest.
ehm.manual-2090: exclusive mode is used to hide the selected players.
ehm.manual-2100: this mode is very useful for projects where we want to show all players except a few.
ehm.manual-2110: by default, exclusive mode is selected.
ehm.manual-2120: shows the full list of project players to apply the selection, ordered by player ID.
ehm.manual-2130: this module lets us move along the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2160: by default, and whenever a project is selected, the most recent week is shown.
ehm.manual-2180: button to go back to the start of the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2190: button to go back one season on the project's timeline from the selected point,
ehm.manual-2200: or, failing that, if there is less than one season of data, to the start of the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2210: button to go back one week on the project's timeline from the selected point.
ehm.manual-2220: you can also use the left arrow on the keyboard.
ehm.manual-2230: button to move forward one week on the project's timeline from the selected point.
ehm.manual-2240: you can also use the right arrow on the keyboard.
ehm.manual-2250: button to move forward one season on the project's timeline from the selected point,
ehm.manual-2260: or, failing that, if there is less than one season of data, to the end of the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2280: button to move forward to the end, that is, the most recent point, of the project's timeline.
ehm.manual-2290: this module lets us navigate between the different projects we have configured.
ehm.manual-2310: by default, the first project in the list loads and, when it does, the time point selector moves to the most recent point,
ehm.manual-2320: at the same time, the saved configurations for filter and player sorting are loaded.
ehm.manual-2330: when clicking on the combo, the list of existing projects appears,
ehm.manual-2340: keeping their order as defined in the
ehm.missing-params: required parameters to complete registration are missing.
ehm.name: name
ehm.navigate-help: you can navigate using the right and left arrow keys on your keyboard
ehm.no-remember-password: If you don't remember your password, please register again. Your EHM data is linked to your Hattrick user, so by registering again, you'll recover all the data you already had in EHM.
ehm.now-on: from now on, Easy Hattrick Manager will save your teams' history on a weekly basis
ehm.user-exists: the user already exists, please choose another.
ht.fan-match-expectations-0: We zouden eigenlijk beter thuis blijven
ht.fan-match-expectations-2: Grote kans dat we deze verliezen
ht.fan-match-expectations-3: Ze zijn hoe dan ook de betere ploeg
ht.fan-match-expectations-4: Ze zijn op papier iets sterker
ht.fan-match-expectations-5: We zijn toch wel aan elkaar gewaagd
ht.fan-match-expectations-6: We zijn op papier iets sterker
ht.fan-match-expectations-7: Wij zijn normaal toch de betere ploeg
ht.fan-match-expectations-9: Dit winnen we met de vingers in de neus
ht.fan-match-expectations-10: Hopelijk zijn ze klaar om vernederd te worden
ht.fan-season-expectations-0: We zijn deze reeks niet waardig
ht.fan-season-expectations-1: Iedere dag in deze reeks is mooi meegenomen
ht.fan-season-expectations-2: We zullen ons best moeten doen om in de reeks te blijven
ht.fan-season-expectations-3: In het midden van de tabel eindigen zou mooi zijn
ht.fan-season-expectations-4: We horen thuis in de top-4
ht.fan-season-expectations-5: De titel ligt binnen bereik. Ga er gewoon voor!
ht.fan-season-expectations-7: We zijn echt veel te goed voor deze reeks!
